basics.name: Karissa Tabadero
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a B.S. Computer Science Student in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

highlights: Assist MATH 215 (Applied Calculus I) students with weekly recitation worksheets
Offer help sessions to students outside of class time to review course material
Assist MATH 241 (Calculus I) students with weekly recitation worksheets

awards.title: Manoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to undergraduate students who earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade and did not receive grades W, I, F, or NC for that semester.

awards.title: Mānoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: An automatic $4,000 scholarship per year for four years of undergraduate study for first time degree-seeking students. Students must have a 3.8 high school GPA upon the time of application to UH Manoa.

awards.title: Pearl Harbor Rotary Club Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to applicants of the Hawaii Rotary Youth Foundation Scholarship Program, Pearl Harbor Branch.

awards.title: Stacie and Julie Lee Scholarship
awards.summary: The Stacie and Julie Lee Scholarship was established in gratitude to HBA and the Efurd family, wanting to help defray the cost of college tuition. During Stacie’s senior year, she received the Reverend O.W. “Dub” Efurd Memorial Scholarship. Both Stacie and her mother, Julie,were so moved by the Efurd family’s generosity that they were inspired to establish their own senior scholarship tobless others just as they had been blessed.

awards.title: Outstanding Interact Volunteer Service Award
awards.summary: Awarded for having the most community service hours during the fall semester
